publicationCitation.value: Fungal volatiles can act as carbon sources and semiochemicals to mediate interspecific interactions among bark beetle-associated fungal symbionts

files.description: Fungal growth (culture area) and reproduction (conidia density) measurements for each culture used in the study's three experiments: concurrent, staggered, and carbon-restricted growth. Please refer to the ReadMe file for descriptions of dataset variables.
files.label: Cale_et_al_Experiment_data.csv

dataFile.description: Fungal growth (culture area) and reproduction (conidia density) measurements for each culture used in the study's three experiments: concurrent, staggered, and carbon-restricted growth. Please refer to the ReadMe file for descriptions of dataset variables.

files.description: Concentrations for each headspace VOC detected from cultures of three mountain pine beetle (Dendroctonus ponderosae)-associated fungi: Grosmannia clavigera, Leptographium longiclavatum, and Ophiostoma montium. Please refer to the ReadMe file for descriptions of dataset variables.
files.label: Cale_et_al_FVOC_profiles.csv

dataFile.description: Concentrations for each headspace VOC detected from cultures of three mountain pine beetle (Dendroctonus ponderosae)-associated fungi: Grosmannia clavigera, Leptographium longiclavatum, and Ophiostoma montium. Please refer to the ReadMe file for descriptions of dataset variables.

files.description: Fungal growth (culture area) measurements for each culture in the carbon-restricted growth described in the Supporting Information. Please refer to the ReadMe file for descriptions of dataset variables.
files.label: Cale_et_al_Supporting Data.csv

dataFile.description: Fungal growth (culture area) measurements for each culture in the carbon-restricted growth described in the Supporting Information. Please refer to the ReadMe file for descriptions of dataset variables.
